articles.title: LQD vs. VCLT: Choosing Between Stability and Long-Rate Exposure
articles.mainIdea: LQD vs. VCLT: Choosing Between Stability and Long-Rate Exposure
articles.summary: Motley Fool: LQD vs. VCLT: Choosing Between Stability and Long-Rate Exposure. Both ETFs hold investment-grade corporate bonds, but LQD prioritizes balance while VCLT ties returns more closely to long-term rate moves

articles.title: Here's what stores are open, and which ones are closed, on Christmas
articles.mainIdea: Here's what stores are open, and which ones are closed, on Christmas
articles.summary: Associated Press Finance: Here's what stores are open, and which ones are closed, on Christmas. From department stores to grocery stores, most retailers across the U.S. close early on Christmas Eve and shut their doors entirely on Christmas Day — while others opt to cut back hours. Before you run out the door this Christmas — whether it’s to buy last-minute gifts or simply get out of the house — it’s wise to double-check operating hours, which can differ depending on their location. Walmart will be closed on Christmas Day — and reopen at 6 a.m. on Dec. 26.
